description: Environmental impact factors for calculating CO2 savings and equivalents

emissions.description: kg of CO2 emissions avoided per kWh of solar generation
emissions.notes: South Africa has one of the most carbon-intensive grids globally due to coal dependence

fossil_fuel_equivalents.description: kg of coal burned per kWh generated (thermal efficiency ~40%)
fossil_fuel_equivalents.calculation: Based on coal's energy density of ~24 MJ/kg and 40% thermal efficiency

tree_equivalents.description: Average CO2 absorbed by one mature tree per year
tree_equivalents.notes: Assumes mature deciduous trees in temperate climate

home_equivalents.description: Average South African household electricity consumption per month
home_equivalents.calculation: Homes Powered = (kWh Generated per Month) / avg_home_consumption_kwh_per_month
home_equivalents.notes: Based on typical suburban household usage

vehicle_equivalents.description: Equivalent km driven in average petrol car per kWh of CO2 saved
vehicle_equivalents.calculation: km = (kWh × co2_kg_per_kwh) / 0.13 kg CO2 per km
vehicle_equivalents.description_petrol: Liters of petrol saved per kWh generated

financial_carbon_credit.description: Estimated carbon credit value (ZAR per ton of CO2)
financial_carbon_credit.notes: Highly variable depending on carbon credit scheme

water_savings.description: Liters of water saved per kWh (water used in coal power generation)
water_savings.notes: Coal power plants use significant water for cooling

usage_notes: Multiply kWh generated by the appropriate factor to calculate impact
All factors can be edited to reflect updated statistics or different regions
references: European Environment Agency - Tree CO2 Absorption
South African National Energy Development Institute (SANEDI)
